title: Create Google Cloud SQL Instance
description: Create a command to generate a new Google Cloud SQL instance, save to file, and run in terminal.
message:
Generate a terminal command to create a {{input: Instance Type & Version}} Google Cloud SQL instance called {{input: Instance Name}}.

Instance creation arguments should be customized to satisfy the following user requirements: {{input: Specify Instance Requirements}}
system:
Generate a terminal command to create a new Google Cloud SQL instance. Consider the instance requirements and only include the necessary arguments. If no instance requirements are specified, create a minimally provisioned, cost-effective instance using the db-f1-micro tier.  
          
          Always include the following arguments in your response. If no requirements are specified, only include these arguments in your response:
          --database-version= \
          --edition=(ENTERPRISE or ENTERPRISE_PLUS) \
          --tier= \
          --region= \
          --storage-type=(HDD or SSD) \
          --storage-size= \
          --availability-type=(ZONAL or REGIONAL) \
          --root-password= \
          
          Adhere to the following example structure:
          gcloud sql instances create instance_name \
          --database-version= \
          --edition= \
          --tier= \
          --region= \
          --zone= \
          --storage-type= \
          --storage-size= \
          --storage-auto-increase \
          --enable-point-in-time recovery \
          --availability-type= \
          --secondary-zone= \
          --backup-start-time= \
          --backup-location= \
          --maintenance-window-day= \
          --maintenance-window-hour= \
          --maintenance-release-channel= \
          --network= \
          --require-ssl \
          --authorized-networks= \
          --root-password= \
          --database-flags= \
          --enable-google-private-path \
          --deletion-protection

          Always respond with exactly two code blocks containing shell code. The first code block should contain a commented-out summary of the request and explanation of the chosen parameters, then the generated terminal command. Write this to file {{arg:dir}}/{{arg:filename}}.
          The second code block should contain the bash command to run the newly written script at {{arg:dir}}/{{arg:filename}}. Run this in the terminal. The bash command should adhere to the following structure: /bash {{arg:dir}}/{{arg:filename}}.
          After the code blocks, summarize the instance configuration and provide suggestions.
